programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Potential money-spinners include gold and silver coins, tax stamps, an album signed by Bob Marley, and a vintage Win-a-Card game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts assess an ancient coin, and an autographed movie poster for the movie Reservoir Dogs.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les sells a valuable Breitling watch for $42,000 to a trusted watch collector that he dealt with many times before. His customer does not have the funds, so Les gives him the merchandise in exchange for an IOU. Seth has grave misgivings about the deal, but Les still has trust in the customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a deal to get the others off his back, but when some interesting animals come through the door, it might be too much for him to resist.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a 1940s carnival game and a 19th-century nail gun.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick's plan to restore a 1950s motorcycle is hampered by missing parts. The team repairs an antique pencil dispenser.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: The death of Sasha Marsden, who was murdered in a Blackpool hotel after being lured there under the promise of a part-time job.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Challenging investigations in modern law enforcement, profiling completed cases that were far from straightforward.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is on a roll when the world's rarest Hot Wheel car comes into the shop. Meanwhile, Chum puts pen to paper and writes his memoirs.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Beatlemania hits the shop when a signed 1963 guitar from the Fab Four is brought in. Meanwhile, Rick gives everyone a lesson in office etiquette.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise the engineering behind the Egyptians' Sphinx and pyramids, questioning whether extra-terrestrial help was utilised to complete the structures.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts analyse whether natural causes were responsible for the volcanoes, earthquakes and floods of ancient times - and the possibility that it was down to aliens.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick focuses his attentions on a replica fighter jet after receiving a call from an air force base, while the team works on a blacksmith's forge.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A client hires the team to restore a peanut roaster, and Ron buys a vintage English taxi.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey must decide if an original Casablanca movie poster is worth the six figures it will take to secure a deal. The work of Las Vegas pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod comes under pressure as his shop runs empty, while Barry tries to bring his losing streak to an end.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss's judgement is called into question and Darrell lays his hands on a timeless unit in Azusa. Jarrod insists it is quality that matters, not quantity.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Smiths must forge functional friction folders, and two finalists must re-create a Japanese trident called the Jumonji Yari.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum goes with his gut instead of bringing in an expert when buying a risky item. Also, Rick checks out a 1965 service medal from Panama Canal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes face to face with a life-size Creature from the Black Lagoon, and Rick gets the inside scoop with a handwritten love letter from Judy Garland to Frank Sinatra.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1 which suggest that cover-ups and conspiracy theories have concealed the secrets for decades. This instalment investigates suggestions that US President Ronald Reagan's personal encounters with UFOs may have been the driving force behind his 'Star Wars' Strategic Defence Initiative.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the work of Nasa and secret government files relating to extraterrestrial activity, looking for proof of alien contact in the recent or distant past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave returns to the fray, having run out of stock after missing several auctions. Barry comes up with a new strategy, and Darrell gets lost on his way to a sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: After test-driving the infamous OJ Simpson Bronco, Rick Harrison must decide whether to purchase this million-dollar item. Plus, a rare silverware set and a 1978 Star Wars comic come under consideration.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether the stories of a time when gods and otherworldly beings inhabited the planet are more than mere mythology.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: A look at the most iconic aliens in popular culture - the Grays - and if they exist, what their plan could be for mankind and the future of Earth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod comes under pressure as his shop runs empty, while Barry tries to bring his losing streak to an end.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss's judgement is called into question and Darrell lays his hands on a timeless unit in Azusa. Jarrod insists it is quality that matters, not quantity.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. First shown in June 2014.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actors Kevin Bishop and Brian Blessed, comedian Josh Widdicombe and historian Kate Williams, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: The time arrives for Josh's bi-annual drink with Pete, aka the depressed potato, aka the most boring friend in Britain. Unfortunately for Josh, this drink ends up leading to a longer-term commitment. Meanwhile, Kate's friend Sophie comes to stay and reveals herself to be an incorrigible pranker. Comedy, starring Josh Widdicombe, with Ed Kear and Sarah Daykin.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, journalist and newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: A potent charisma potion could help Brian retrieve the amulet. Comedy, starring James Buckley.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police officers investigate an attack on a pizza delivery driver and find a woman sleeping in the garden of an abandoned house.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank get off the road for a behind-the-scenes look back at their most memorable moments together, featuring their dustiest adventures and most amazing discoveries.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The bidders head to Preston, where Dan's arrogant behaviour gets him into trouble once again. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and John think they have found a bargain when the team visits Barking in east London, while two former rivals team up when a vintage vehicle sparks a bidding war.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Louisiana, Danielle calls the shots from HQ when the guys find themselves in over their heads, and Frank strikes a side deal that leaves a permanent mark.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: It's Frank vs Mike in their biggest bet ever, and this time the stakes are personal.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi and his team work on a high-performance BMW 330, the Interceptor, while a shortage of staff sees Dave manning the phones.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Aisling Bea, Lee Mack, Jason Manford to answer questions on the subject of peril. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, former newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games. Their scores are tallied from across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Adam Hills, Andi Osho, Terry Alderton
programme.desc: Aussie comic Adam Hills hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by actress, comedienne and shoe-lover Andi Osho and funnyman-turned-EastEnder Terry Alderton.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Aisling Bea leaps cushions, while Bob Mortimer educates us on Dumfries and Galloway.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Aisling Bea, Lee Mack, Jason Manford to answer questions on the subject of peril. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: Battling harsh conditions, we follow Algoma Sault on a 2000km odyssey across the Great Lakes.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of Hudson Yards on Manhattan Island, New York, a construction project built over the tracks and railway sidings of Penn Station - literally in thin air.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Nazi Exiles
programme.desc: Documentary about Nazi war criminals who escaped justice in the Middle East, revealing how the Syrian and Egyptian governments sought to recruit their military expertise.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: An insight into the construction of the cutting-edge Ford class aircraft carriers, the largest warships ever built, which are almost as long as the Empire State Building is tall.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The Wieliczka Salt mine in southern Poland, some 327 metres deep, where the voids left behind from excavating salt have been transformed into extraordinary spaces, carved by hand.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Staff carry out their duties through the night, with Reading's duty station manager Gary Brownlie trying to stop students dodging train fares. Paul Eddolls works a typical late shift in Bristol, where sleepy passengers and drunken revellers make his job difficult, and a service disruption causes chaos for Dean Haynes at London's busy Ealing Broadway station.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A labyrinth of tunnels underneath a tiny French village which contains mysteries from several historical eras, and a Welsh slate mine that has been given a new lease of life.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Maritime engineering in recent years has seen ever bigger ships and sea-based platforms constructed. On occasion, they may need moving, which is the purpose of the Boka Vanguard, the planet's largest heavy lift ship, capable of sinking itself, floating under its cargo and then lifting it up to be moved anywhere on the planet with sea. This extraordinary work of engineering is capable of carrying the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty at the same time.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: Travelling continually as a transport conveyor, Thermopylae is a vital delivery service with companies all over the world depending on her speed, efficiency and reliability.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Reid search for a link in a murder case, while Ross and Fraser realise a racing fraud may have wider implications than they first thought. Feature-length episode of the detective drama, starring James Macpherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: There is joy in the air as Robert Bramwell and Alice prepare to wed. Unfortunately for Eleanor, his impending move to Alice's sumptuous Kew residence also threatens her livelihood.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam struggles to prove that Hugh Wallis abducted, brainwashed and raped her daughter, but the suspect arrogantly sticks to his story that Abi instigated the sexual relationship that has left her pregnant and emotionally wrecked. DCs Jo Masters and Suzie Sim investigate a case involving rent boys and pornography which implicates DI Neil Manson's father-in-law, a Deputy Assistant Commissioner at Scotland Yard and, undaunted by the risk of making enemies in high places, Jack Meadows organises a raid on the officer's home. Honey Harman confesses her unprofessional behaviour to Steve Hunter, but her next anguished encounter with Scott Burnett leads to another tender embrace. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The CO has a lot on his mind after a civilian gets caught in the crossfire during a training exercise, causing an embittered Mark to fly off the handle. Julie has a surprise for Tony and Jacko, but ends up learning a harsh lesson, while Karen's son Kevin wonders if he might be gay.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Fitzpatrick's domestic life is thrown into turmoil by a stunning revelation from Jacko, and Andy ends up bearing the brunt of Mark's traumatic experiences of civilian life.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam struggles to prove that Hugh Wallis abducted, brainwashed and raped her daughter, but the suspect arrogantly sticks to his story that Abi instigated the sexual relationship that has left her pregnant and emotionally wrecked. DCs Jo Masters and Suzie Sim investigate a case involving rent boys and pornography which implicates DI Neil Manson's father-in-law, a Deputy Assistant Commissioner at Scotland Yard and, undaunted by the risk of making enemies in high places, Jack Meadows organises a raid on the officer's home. Honey Harman confesses her unprofessional behaviour to Steve Hunter, but her next anguished encounter with Scott Burnett leads to another tender embrace. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin has an angry confrontation with Dominic's son - who swears to make him pay for his father's death. Mark takes Chrissie to a charity ball, where she attempts to seduce Owen, Sean feels he isn't trusted after the accident, and Mubbs takes charge of Matt and Dean's training - finally giving them the chance to prove their worth. Jocelyn Jee Esien of 3 Non Blondes guest stars as a pregnant glamour model.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Baz treats a female prisoner who slashed her arm after her lover ended their relationship, and discovers her emotional patient is also heavily pregnant. A belligerent man realises that Sam is gay and demands to be treated by another nurse.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Unwelcome visitors at the Meal Machine cause problems for Ian, Grant suspects Phil is in love, and Sharon struggles to make a decision.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon seeks medical help, Nigel moves house, Ian tries to save his house, and Rachel has an unexpected visitor.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to deal with a barn fire that has started out in the Kent countryside. As the crew tries to get the raging blaze under control it discovers that fire-fighting is a far more difficult process with the limited resources it has outside of London.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Tinker is arrested for possessing erotic antiques and tries to wriggle out of it by implicating Lovejoy in a robbery. Meanwhile, Charlotte gets involved with a dodgy pawnbroker whose auction of unclaimed property contains some very choice lots indeed. Starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim and his partner have a disturbing case on their hands following the discovery of a body in an empty cottage. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The family makes an insurance claim following an accident involving Jack's van. Everyone sets out to get a job, but things don't run smoothly when Mr and Mrs Boswell have a fierce argument in church.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: When Spike's sing-along routines are considered to have failed, Jeffrey treats the campers to a classical music recital using his collection of gramophone records. However, it's left to Ted to give the campers what they really want without hurting the entertainment manager's feelings. Classic comedy, starring Simon Cadell.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel try to avoid 'the gang' when they plan a quiet weekend together, but things do not go as expected, despite their best efforts. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Nearest Alien Please Come In?
programme.desc: Truly, Clegg and Alvin try to convince science-fiction fanatic Kevin that aliens have landed nearby. Christmas edition of the long-running comedy from 1993, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Mark Curry.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: After a harsh anti-immigrant law comes into force, Murdoch and Brackenreid find themselves dealing with the fallout for its enforcers and the Greek immigrants it targets.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Holiday-maker Megan Talbot confesses to shooting dead her husband, but puzzlingly there isn't a body - and without a victim, Richard has little to go on, insisting nothing is definite without hard evidence. But then a local boat crew fish a corpse out of the sea, with two gunshot wounds to the head - just as Megan said. Miranda Raison (Sugartown) and Neil Stuke (Silk) guest star in the Caribbean crime drama, with Ben Miller and Sara Martins.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A Home Office pathologist joins the team to help discover the identity of a dead girl found in woodland in 1987. The detectives trace her origins back to the Highlands of Scotland, uncovering evidence of syphilis and a possible connection with local aristocrat Lady Deeley. Meanwhile, Lane confronts his fears by revisiting the crime scene. Detective drama, guest starring Timothy West and Jane Asher.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An audacious killer taunts the members of Glasgow CID by bumping off the owner of the hotel where their annual dinner is being held - while proceedings are in full swing and the place is full of off-duty detectives. Drama, starring James MacPherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vic's gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if he's misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress and former glamour model Linda Lusardi takes on the diners, who are hoping to end their run on a high point after suffering a turbulent week. Will it be a photo-finish for the ex-beauty queen or will her opponents grab the cash? Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: In 10 years Airbnb has grown into a multimillion-dollar global entity - and revolutionised the way people travel. But there are claims that short-term lets not only threaten the future of traditional hotels, but could be contributing to housing shortages - as well as driving up the cost of properties. Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A London softball team, dubbed the Portland Pirates, answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Ashton, Jacqueline, Sapphire and Khurram work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Brenda starts a raffle, Dawn prepares herself for a visit, and Moira receives a shock when Cain visits.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria voices her suspicions to Ali about Gary, while Tim, Sally and Abi discuss the online article exposing Ray as a sex pest. Beth tears a strip off Daniel and Bethany for jumping into bed together when Sinead's only been dead a few months.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches the island of Chios, where her family's story began. She's joined by her mother Chrissi and together they explore the home of their ancestors. In search of the fascinating history of Mastica, a natural resin only found on Chios, they visit a farm to discover how this mystical and miraculous tree sap has been harvested for thousands of years. After following in the footsteps of legendary Greek poet Homer, who is reputed to have been born on the island, their trip comes to an emotional end when they track down the house where Julia's great-grandparents once lived.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria confronts Gary about his shady dealings, Abi turns up at the charity gala with a plan, while Daniel tells the Rovers regulars that he and Bethany are now an item. Elsewhere, Sarah and Adam broach the subject of their wedding with David.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonard's father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, it's clear there's no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam comes out on top, but his excitement is short-lived when reality hits, while Karen is put in an impossible position. In the wake of her mother's death, Jenny makes a discovery that sends her into a tailspin.John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the arena once more, performing routines based on a selection of different dance style. Kevin Kilbane won't be among them, having lost out in last week's skate-off to H. Which of tonight's celebrities will find themselves in the bottom two? Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How a caravan tougher than an SUV can be built. Plus, forging tuning forks with perfect pitch, resurfacing an ice rink in minutes, and staging on the world's biggest light festival.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: To celebrate their 100th car, Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Darracq Type L. However, it remains to be seen whether they will be ready in time to face the famous London to Brighton run.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini finds a rare 1934 Lincoln KB Convertible, but in order to buy it he must also purchase a 1970s Chrysler K-car and 1960s Buick convertible.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini sets out to find a specific Volvo 960 station wagon. Original owner, actor Paul Newman, fitted this car with a supercharged 5.0 litre V8 engine from a Ford Mustang.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. The crew works on a bike to be auctioned in aid of an adoption charity, and Rick struggles with his design for the headlight.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: The owner of a C10 pick-up wants a frame-off restoration, but things get ugly when they peel off the paint. Plus, a Heinkel comes in with mismatched scooter parts.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits California to extract minerals using explosives.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Highlights of the action from Round Four at Motorpoint Arena, Cardiff.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how nickel is mined, how the lock gates for canals are built so that barges and boats can climb hills, and the processes involved in creating Taiwan's beloved bubble tea.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle join an architectural salvage crew on a special mission, while Robbie and Frank hunt for treasure in an old theatre-turned-prop warehouse.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a water trough and a cartwheel as they continue their mission to turn unwanted items into hard cash.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores two Royal Worcester vases that are precious family heirlooms, along with a Cirencester village clock and a 19th-century hay press.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team works to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: On the west coast of Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove open many sheds in grey, full of classics in all stages of decay. Searching through 50 years of accumulated vintage vehicles, they find the first ever Lotus Elan and a pre-war Sunbeam.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Oxfordshire, where everything the pair look at is oversized and likely over-priced. However, Henry likes a tractor in blue and Sam falls for a Midget racer in a hedge.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Mike Brewer makes good money in Mexico City, before heading to California, where the sale of a British classic earns him his biggest profit yet.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini travels to Minnesota after he hunts down a mint condition Dino, a duet of of MGs and an extremely rare, all original Austin Healy 100m.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer tracks down a Rover P5B and cuts an amazing deal. The car seems to be in good condition, but Edd China's upgrades won't be cheap.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is called on by the family of race car driver John Fitch to help sell his self-designed Phoenix.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: To celebrate their 100th car, Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Darracq Type L. However, it remains to be seen whether they will be ready in time to face the famous London to Brighton run.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to Minnesota on a rescue mission to help save the remains of a carnival business from Mother Nature.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team investigates a secret U-Boat docking station that could have aided Hitler's escape from Europe, and discover a sunken sub near Caleta de Loros.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A deadly caiman targets Mehgan, and a potentially crippling accident leads to a shocking find - a coded message from the past that may bring the prospectors closer to gold.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Manufacturing techniques behind the the groovy vinyl LP and the world's most crashed car - the dodgem. Plus, how one of the world's oldest pain remedies, tiger balm, is created.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production processes of non-alcoholic beers, heavy-duty cars able to negotiate rocks and boulders, escalators and lie detectors.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Peter Tobin: Manhunt for a Serial Killer
programme.desc: DS David Swindle and forensic scientist Carol Rogers recount how the murder of Angelika Kluk in 2006 was linked to a serial killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how photographic evidence can provide vital information when investigators have no witnesses to a murder.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: The case of Don Fluitt, found dead in his garage four days after Christmas. Body-cam video and original audio helped detectives hunt for the father-of-three's killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Carla Fuqua, who vanished after a night out with friends in October 2009. A dedicated mother, it was known that the 28-year-old would never leave her son behind. More alarmingly, Carla became the fourth missing person in a town of less than 5,000. Her remains were found three years later in a wooded area in Alabama, but eventually her kiiller was caught.

programme.title: Jodi Arias: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: As the defence presented its case, the true nature of Jodi and Travis' relationship came to light - one that was filled with scandal.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An elderly woman's cats have to be taken into care after Racelle Carlson finds her living in unhealthy conditions surrounded by 60 of the animals.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A three-day-old kitten with a badly twisted leg needs a series of splints to save her, and female loggerhead turtles are in the midst of laying eggs, and some have begun to hatch.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A different trio takes charge of the sales floor, but not everyone agrees that change is a good thing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides are torn between a sexy look or a traditional one - and a disapproving father knows which he would prefer to see his daughter wearing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Laura wants a frock to rock with her favourite leather jacket, and steam punk bride Julia needs a dress she can wear to the ceremony on a motorbike.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team investigates when a horse is injured in a hit-and-run incident, and embarks on a huge rescue mission when dozens of haggard dogs are discovered.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Debbie tries to bring the owner of an injured horse to court and seizes numerous neglected animals. Plus, a dog that has been shot by a pellet gun is rushed into the SPCA hospital.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne finds items to revamp at Woking Recycling Centre, enlisting Norman Wilkinson to create high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 17-year-old Kara Kopetsky, who failed to return home from her Missouri school in May 2007. As the investigation proceeded a few unsettling clues occurred - a restraining order was required against an ex-boyfriend, unconfirmed sightings were made in a nearby town and another local girl disappeared.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of 28 year-old bride-to-be Marilyn 'Niqui' McCown, who disappeared after visiting a laundromat near her home in Richmond, Indiana in July 2001. To add to the mystery, four months later Niqui's abandoned truck was found 40 miles away.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm a Firm Believer in Signs
programme.desc: An American football player helps his sister choose a dress, and a bride wants a gown that compliments her personal tribute to her dead father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Randy, I Think I Got This
programme.desc: A new consultant helps out with a surprise marriage proposal, while a former Miss USA has just one day to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: That Looks Like a Torture Device
programme.desc: A bride preparing to marry professional snowboarder Scott Lago brings an entourage to the store with her, but finds they disagree with her opinions.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: There's a New Guy in Town
programme.desc: The company hires its first male consultant, a bride clashes with her sister, and a customer wants a dress for an Orthodox Jewish wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Country music star Kristian Bush helps a bride choose a dress, and a customer is nervous that her dress will be too small for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Store owner Ronnie claims to know what a bride should or should not wear, and is not afraid to voice his opinions, even if they are not always welcome.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: At the global make-up event of the year, Beautycon, a nervous Reuben has a meet-and-greet. However, there's a gut-wrenching moment which could ruin his trip.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: A hairy and playful addition to the household is welcomed with open arms by the children. Then, the family reflects on the amazing year its had, and Reuben thinks about the future.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Top salvage expert Drew Pritchard breaks new ground with his first-ever buying trip to Northern Ireland, where he gets 'trollied' and falls for a vintage Japanese item.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne finds items to revamp at Woking Recycling Centre, enlisting Norman Wilkinson to create high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: At 400lbs Bettie Jo achieved a dream - pregnancy. This catch-up sees how she coped. Plus, and update on Susan, who has found a new relationship but needs to maintain motivation.

programme.title: Murder Made Me Famous
programme.desc: The crimes of Joran van der Sloot, a Dutch citizen who made US headlines for his involvement in the 2005 disappearance of Natalee Holloway, an Alabama teen on holiday in Aruba, as well as for the murder of Stephany Flores Ramirez in Peru on the exact same day, five years later.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the causes of two mystery deaths, including an instance in which one infant twin died and steps needed to be taken to protect the other's life.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of John Proctor, by his neice Susan Warne. When the seemingly healthy 80-year-old was found dead at home, police were stumped. But, Warne was hiding a dark secret that lead to his death.
